string_data:
Looking at my previous output, I can see I made a mistake. I failed to include some clear disruption effects in the disruption content block. Let me provide the corrected version:

ID: Metro_None_Judge-puts-Just-Stop
Source: Metro
Title: Judge puts Just Stop Oil protester in her place over 9,000-mile trip to India
Content: #DS #PH #CS Noah Crane, Hannah Taylor, Hanan Ameur, Poppy Bliss and Lydia Gribbin from Just Stop Oil outside Westminster Magistrates' Court (Alt: Five young people stand outside Westminster Magistrates Court, identified as Just Stop Oil protesters. They wear casual clothing including jackets and appear to be posing for media. An inset image shows protesters holding a red banner with the Extinction Rebellion symbol inside what appears to be a gallery or museum setting.) #CE
A judge has refused to delay the trial of Just Stop Oil protesters charged with storming a performance of West End musical, Les Miserables, at the request of one defendant who said they were flying to India.The performance at London's Sondheim Theatre was halted around 9pm on October 5 after a group of activists invaded the stage.Hannah Taylor, 23; Lydia Gribbin, 28; Hanan Ameur, 22; Noah Crane, 18; and Poppy Bliss, 19, all appeared at Westminster Magistrates' Court today where they denied one count of aggravated trespass. #DE District Judge Michael Snow set the trial date for February 5 next year.But Gribbin asked the judge if the hearing could be delayed until the end of February, as she will be away.#NS The judge appeared less than impressed, responding: "I am afraid I am not going to wait for you to get back from India. If you have to miss out on things, you have to miss out on things." #NE
#DS #PH #CS The protesters invaded a production of Les Miserables on October 5 (Alt: The image shows a theatrical stage during a performance of Les Miserables. A protester in bright yellow clothing holds a red flag while standing center stage under dramatic lighting. Cast members in period costumes are positioned around the stage, with audience members visible in the foreground watching the disrupted performance.) #CE
The estimated cost to the theatre of cancelling the performance was £80,000, the court heard.The judge said that they could be liable to pay the full amount if they are found guilty.A group of activists disrupted the long-running theatre show during a rendition of the song, One Day More, which sees a performer waving a red flag.They unfurled their trademark orange Just Stop Oil flag instead – #NS to be met by boos by furious audience members. #NE The protesters then chained themselves to the stage with bicycle locks – prompting the cast to be forced backstage while the audience was ushered outside. #DE #MS The protest was part of Just Stop Oil's attempt to raise awareness of the climate crisis and stop fossil fuel use. #ME
